programme.title: Wildest Latin America: Pantanal: Brazil's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Every year the Pantanal is drowned by immense floods, and then suffer severe drought. Yet, while people struggle, the Pantanal hosts some of the greatest gatherings of animals on the planet.

programme.title: Wildest Arctic: Taiga: The Frozen Forest
programme.desc: Containing one third of the world's trees, the frozen forests of the Taiga are the lungs of the planet. This great forest spans across shores of the Pacific, sheltering some of the Earth's most majestic animals, and some of its most secretive.

programme.title: Wildest Arctic: The Tundra: Desert of Ice
programme.desc: Covering a fifth of the earth's surface, the Arctic tundra is one of the coldest places on the planet. The piercing temperatures and powerful winds challenge even the hardiest of creatures.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Falkland Islands: Penguin Paradise
programme.desc: The Falkland's bleak, battered, and windswept archipelago lies 460 km from the South American mainland. Rugged mountains and expansive pristine coastline are a unique home for wildlife  especially for one of the world's most iconic flightless birds.

programme.title: Wildest Middle East: Caspian: The Hidden Cradle
programme.desc: At the the heart of one of the most ancient parts of the civilized world, the Caspian sea is the largest land locked body of water on earth. This terrain is home to some of the most unique, mysterious and prehistoric creatures on earth.

programme.desc: Tonight, we head south to Tasmania to see recently married couple JAMES & MELANIE devise and prepare their three-course menu. There will be thrills and spills as they battle the clock and their nerves to plate up on time.

programme.title: My Kitchen Rules Australia: Episode 6
programme.desc: Tonight, we venture to West Australia to see Italian cousins DANIELA & STEFANIA devise and prepare their three-course menu. There will be thrills and spills as they battle the clock and their nerves to plate up on time.

programme.title: The New Detectives: For Love Or Money
programme.desc: Every family has its secrets, and sometimes blood relations lead to bloodshed. When money is the motive, murder can rip at the very foundation of marriage and family.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Without A Trace
programme.desc: Missing Person: Approximately 1.8 million Americans are reported missing each year. Worldwide, the number of missing persons nearly triples.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Signed In Blood
programme.desc: Handwriting Analysis: We've all heard that our handwriting tells more about our personalities than we think. Are we risk-takers, have low-esteem, fun loving, or are we capable of murder?

programme.title: The New Detectives: Tainted Trust
programme.desc: Poison is the subtlest form of death, and investigators must see through unusual circumstances to bring these murders to light.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Unlikely Sources
programme.desc: Some of the best clues come from the least likely places. Baffling crimes have been solved and criminals betrayed through evidence provided by insects, beer bottles, and other seemingly meaningless objects.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: One contestant's overly speedy delivery arouses Gordon's suspicions. Will they be able to win back his respect during the first dinner service of the series?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: In the second show of the series, the men hope to redress the balance after last week's disastrous start as they take on a beach side challenge. Later, a ruined risotto could spell the end of the line for one unlucky hopeful.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Despite having three chefs ejected, it looks like the blue team's fortunes could be improving after another fraught dinner service. Will raw fish and overcooked meat spell the end for more than one hopeful from the red team?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Gordon challenges the teams to cater a school graduation ceremony before they face another star-studded dinner service. With certain hopefuls bent on sabotage, which team will emerge victorious?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: After a protein test challenge, the teams gear up for another stressful dinner service, this time attended by Gordon's mother Helen. One team finishes way in the lead, but which of the hopefuls will be taking the fall this week?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The teams must herd farm animals into their proper pens and decide which proteins and starches they will use next.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Car builder Ian Roussel transforms a mini-kit van into a crazy utility vehicle.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Car builder Ian Roussel takes on one of his biggest challenges yet as he tries to turn a Wild Cartoon drawing into a real life Hot Rod. Part 1 of 2.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Car builder Ian Roussel continues the challenge as he tries to turn a Wild Cartoon drawing into a real life Hot Rod. Part 2 of 2.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Car builder Ian Roussel takes on two Ford Falcon projects. Part 1 of 2.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Car builder Ian Roussel continues the transformation of the two Ford Falcons. Part 2 of 2.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Car builder Ian Roussel takes on a classic 1958 Harley Davidson and a 1984 Kawasaki police cruiser.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: The Andromeda discovers her sister ship, the Pax Magellanic. The crew aboard Pax is 300 years old, but have not aged a day.

programme.title: Andromeda: Music of a Distant Drum
programme.desc: Tyr crash lands the Eureka Maru on a Nietzschean planet and develops amnesia. He must remember what he is doing before the Nietzscheans discover him and his crate of stolen goods.

programme.title: Andromeda: Harper 2.0
programme.desc: Harper receives the gift of knowledge from a dying Perseid, only to discover that the Perseid was being sought by a bounty hunter who has now turned his attention to Harper.

programme.title: Andromeda: Forced Perspective
programme.desc: Dylan is arrested for assassinating a dictator 300 years ago.

programme.title: Andromeda: The Sum of Its Parts
programme.desc: Andromeda is boarded by a drone from the Consensus of Parts, a mythical mechanical society. While friendly at first, the drone tries to force the ship to join the Consensus.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Looking for Justice
programme.desc: This week, for the first time ever, the prime suspect in a murder enquiry has turned to Sensing Murder for help.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: When The Trail Goes Cold
programme.desc: This episodes involves the disappearance of 62-year-old Kaye Stewart, a woman who went missing while on a short walk on June 13th, 2005.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: The Patient Killer
programme.desc: In 1976, thirteen-year-old schoolgirl Tracey Ann Patient was plucked off Auckland's Great North Road. The following morning, her body was found dumped 16 km away in the Waitakere Ranges, having been strangled with a pantyhose tourniquet.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Long Way Home
programme.desc: 25-year-old Te Puke woman Judy Yorke was a devoted single mum who adored her kids. When she missed her daughter’s fourth birthday party, her family knew something was terribly wrong and reported her missing.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: A Mother's Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: Otautau toddler Amber-Lee, aged two and a half, vanished from Kingston at the southern tip of Lake Wakatipu on October 17, 1992.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Kimberley Killer
programme.desc: Seven years after the disappearance of baby Azaria Chamberlain at Ayers rock, long before the murder of Peter Falconio on a remote stretch of highway in the Australian outback and two years before Ivan Milat begins his reign of backpacker murders.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Murder of Innocence: Sian Kingi
programme.desc: On 27 November 1987, 12-year-old Noosa school girl Sian Kingi was grabbed off her push bike by Valmae Fay Beck and Barrie John Watts as she rode home from school.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Mystery of the Homestead Murders
programme.desc: The quick mind of a country telephone exchange supervisor led to a horrific discovery at a NSW country homestead in 1978.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Devil Inside: John Ernest Cribb
programme.desc: A chilling investigation of John Ernest Cribb, who on August 11, 1978 broke into the home of the Connell's. On a winter’s afternoon, Valda Connell and her four-year-old son Damien arrived home after having collected ten-year-old Sally from school.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Butchered Boys
programme.desc: This episode revisits Adelaide's notorious Adelaide Family Murders case, where six young Adelaide men were murdered during the 1970s and '80s. The victims were found in random locations throughout the state, their bodies neatly cut into pieces.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Grace faces an uphill battle to save Ashleigh's life, after they are involved in a serious car accident on an isolated road. An expensive stud bull is murdered on Drovers Run, and the girls are convinced someone is trying to bankrupt them.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Grace is shocked when Heath proposes marriage. Will she accept? The girls host a spectacular medieval pageant to raise money for Drought Relief.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Grace takes drastic action to capture a cattle thief. The girls uncover Ashleigh's plan to bankrupt Drovers Run. But can they stop her before it's too late?

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Kate is convinced she has killed Ashleigh in a hit and run accident. But where is the body? Stevie discovers she's pregnant. It's Halloween and the horror stories the girls tell over dinner start to come true.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Grace is offered the chance of a lifetime by Heath, but only if she's prepared to leave Drovers forever. A mysterious stranger forces Grace to reconsider her future with Heath. Patrick organises a surprise party for Tayler's 18th birthday.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Grace is offered the chance of a lifetime by Heath, but only if she's prepared to leave Drovers forever. A mysterious stranger forces Grace to reconsider her future with Heath. Patrick organises a surprise party for Tayler's 18th birthday.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Rick Silva became CEO of Checkers & Rallys fast food restaurants five years ago, and immediately focused on growing the business at any cost. So he is going undercover to find even more ways to drive sales and please his guests.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Canlan Ice Sports Corp is the largest private owner of sports facilities in North America. CEO Joey St Aubin admits their prices are higher than local municipal rinks, but believes his company offers a premium service and better ice quality.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Stacey Mowbray, CEO of Canada’s largest specialty coffee company goes undercover and gets into the grind serving lattes to get an edge on customer service and revive her connection with frontline workers.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Rick Tigner, the president of Kendall-Jackson Wine Estates, the second largest family owned wine company in the world, goes undercover posing as a grocery store employee who is pursuing his dream job in the wine industry.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) City Councillor and TTC Chair Karen Stintz goes undercover inside the country's largest mass transit system to get her hands dirty with some of the toughest and grittiest jobs.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Episode 4
programme.desc: Despite mysterious and unnerving warnings from locals, the Ghost Hunters face their fears and stay on mission: to help people confront terrifying paranormal encounters that have shaken them to their core.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters
programme.desc: Despite mysterious and unnerving warnings from locals, the Ghost Hunters face their fears and stay on mission: to help people confront terrifying paranormal encounters that have shaken them to their core.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Fort Henry
programme.desc: This week, TAPS is called in to investigate the Fort Henry, where it once served as a cornerstone for Canada's military defense and execution site.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Haunted By Heroes
programme.desc: For Grant's second to last case with Ghost Hunters, TAPS revisits one of Grant's favorite locations, Mt. Washington, in New Hampshire. Last time TAPS was here, they caught one of the best EVP's ever.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Midnight Run
programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Hunt for Santa
programme.desc: Dog decides he needs to help his son Garry believe in Santa Claus again. So now the Dog, with a posse expanded to include his children and grandchildren, sets off on a hunt through the Colorado Rockies for Santa Claus himself!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Call Waiting
programme.desc: Dog's target for today has been in trouble with the law since he was a juvenile. And he seems willing to use any trick in the system to avoid capture by Dog. In this match of wits, will Dog prevail?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Kid Stuff
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address. The posse's one hope is to locate his girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Easy Does It
programme.desc: There is a running joke in the posse that every time Bobby Brown asks them for help with a fugitive, he always promises them it's "an easy one," but the hunts end up being epic searches.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Dog believes in safety first, and today's hunt puts this philosophy to the test. The fugitive's problem with anger management increases the dangers of their already risky line of work. Dog warns the crew to be ready for anything as they head out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Back in the Hood
programme.desc: Today, Dog's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills to track his prey.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: One for the Road
programme.desc: Dog is a big-hearted guy. He's helping Mary Ellen, his friend and fellow bondsman, on a dangerous night hunt for a fugitive she is now regretting bailing out. He's also giving his nephew Justin a second chance to rejoin the team.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bait and Switch
programme.desc: Things are seldom what they seem in the world of bounty hunting. When the fugitive's girlfriend offers to help Dog trap this dangerous felon, Dog knows that someone is being deceived. The only question is, whom?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Glory Is the Reward of Mallard
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots. Willie organizes a bus tour to trace his family heritage.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Good Night and Good Duck
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss." Each family member presents a special holiday segment, with Willie and Jase serving as anchormen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack in the Saddle
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race. Meanwhile, when Kay decides she wants to buy a new birdbath for her yard, she recruits Phil, Martin and Godwin.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: A Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Cannonball Runs
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival - Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Mo Math, Mo Problems
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie, they rekindle an old argument of whether Jase can outrun a truck.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Coop! There It Is!
programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project - renovating the chicken coop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Friday Afternoon Lights
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Master and Duck Commander
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Inlawful Entry
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends. Meanwhile, Willie helps John Luke start his own snow cone business.

programme.title: Timber Kings: Behind the 8 Ball
programme.desc: Andre is on cue to deliver a stunning log pool table for a Williams Lake pub until the owner racks up his request.

programme.title: Timber Kings: Giddy Up
programme.desc: Beat saddles up for Germany and the creation of a western-style guesthouse to match the saloon he built for his cowboy-loving clients.

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 3
programme.desc: Border Patrol Agents along the Rio Grande hunt down Mexican drug smugglers who are moving large stashes across the border. And Mexican Cartels branch into human trafficking, by exploiting a wave of migrants fleeing Central American violence.

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 4
programme.desc: Custom and Border Protection in Arizona itercept drugs even as cartels have become better than ever at hiding them in vehicles. In Rio Grande City, the hunt is on when a group of traffickers smuggles hundreds of pounds of drugs across the river

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 5
programme.desc: DEA agents in St Louis tackle a growing heroin epidemic, one dealer at a time. And St Louis law enforcement pulls out every stop to reverse the city’s culture of drugs

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 6
programme.desc: St Louis DEA expands its investigation into a suspected heroin dealer who has so far dodged them at every turn. And as a heroin epidemic hits America, young addicts in St Louis embark on the battle of their lives to break their addiction

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 7
programme.desc: “Five Dollar Insanity” hits South Florida, as law enforcement battles Flakka, a dangerous new synthetic drug that has invaded the streets.Cody, a St Louis heroin addict struggling to break his addiction, must summon the courage to travel to Florida

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 8
programme.desc: The Falfurrias checkpoint in South Texas cracks down on drug and human traffickers. Their inspections are so effective that they often force migrants and drug smugglers to hike forty miles around the checkpoint to avoid detection

programme.title: Divorce Court: Sick and Tired
programme.desc: Timothy is tired of being kicked out the house every time Erin catches an attitude. If she kicks him out once more, he's gone for good. Erin says she dropped out of college and left behind a full tennis scholarship because of him.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Heart Break Hotel
programme.desc: Brianna says Steven constantly looks at other women behind her back which has taken a toll on her confidence. He says her overprotectiveness leads to arguments that end up with her accusing him of cheating.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Tapped Out
programme.desc: Lataisha says Chris smokes weed all day and can’t keep a job. Things seemed to be going fine until one day she walked downstairs in their home and realized that Chris moved out. Chris says he left because she is too aggressive.

programme.title: Divorce Court: In My Feelings
programme.desc: Raymond, also known as @IamRollingRay, is an Instagram sensation who says his high school sweetheart is jealous of his social media fan base. Christian thinks Ray shows more attention to his fanbase, accusing him of cheating with his followers.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Caught Up
programme.desc: Syncere says Mark has lied and disrespected her on several occasions and she’s not going to stand for it anymore. Mark says he cheats on Syncere because she has a bad attitude and she gets on his nerves.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Runaway Love Part 1
programme.desc: After 21 years together, LaSonya claims her husband still can’t keep his pants zipped and quit the flirting. Daniea Lanier says he is fed up with her attitude and feels she would be happier if she had more self-esteem.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Runaway Love Part 2
programme.desc: After 21 years together, LaSonya claims her husband still can’t keep his pants zipped and quit the flirting. Daniea Lanier says he is fed up with her attitude and feels she would be happier if she had more self-esteem.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Lesbihonest
programme.desc: Porcha has had enough of Ivory's promiscuous behavior. He claims Porcha has more tricks and secrets than Houdini and her lying has taken its toll. Can Judge Lynn Toler help this couple or is it time for Cupid to take better aiming lessons?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Johnny on the Spot
programme.desc: Cornisha says Jawaun leaves for weeks at a time and returns broke and jobless. He says Cornisha is too bossy and picks fights causing him to blow up and take days away to cool down. Will they find a cooling point before their relationship melts down?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Game Boy
programme.desc: Christy is done with Demetrice's video game obsession! He said he's better off with his games than being accused of looking at every woman that passes by. Will Demetrice snap back into reality or is this game over?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Hashtag Freaky
programme.desc: Anita says Ronald is a chronic cheater and a sex addict. He demands sex constantly and when doesn’t get his way, he admits he feels forced to seek sex outside the marriage. Can Judge Toler save this couple?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Crazy About You
programme.desc: Mali is five years younger than his girlfriend Zay and they are total opposites. He still wants to party, and she is ready to settle down.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Photo Op
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business. But the family comes together as they set out to hunt a chronic violator with an open warrant and a wife who has an odd request for Dog.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bosco the Clown
programme.desc: Dog and the team get a big surprise after they track down Bosco, a fugitive who they believe is addicted to methamphetamines. They discover he's off drugs, settling into a normal life with a new girlfriend, and is very friendly.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Moms & Dads
programme.desc: Dog pursues two people whose lives have been ruined by drugs. First, he tracks Mae, who traded a good home and loving family for an ice pipe. The next case involves Jude. His addiction has caused his pregnant wife to fear for her safety.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mid-Course Correction
programme.desc: Dog's target for today was once an upstanding member of his community. Now with no home, no job and the law on his trail, this middle-aged exile from middle-class society is using the cold end of an ice pipe to soothe his troubled soul.

programme.title: Operation Repo: We Are Operation Repo
programme.desc: After we meet the team members of Operation Repo, Matt, Lou, and Froy get interrupted by a bike riding gangster while trying to hook up a car. And later, Matt, Sonia, and Froy deal with an ecstatic and energetic young debtor who will not let go of her car

programme.title: Operation Repo: Mile High Mayhem
programme.desc: On this special season finale of Operation Repo, the team gears up for a mile-high repo of a lifetime! Froy and Sonia repo a water blob from a lake house, but the RO and his friends refuse to let this deflate their party.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Disaster at the Derby
programme.desc: The repo team confronts the toughest challenge yet: one-on-one interviews with an anger management specialist. Lyndah and Froy head to the Hollywood Hills to find a luxury sedan.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Pizza, Hook-ups, and a Suspicious Suitcase
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy interrupt a young couple's romantic entanglement when they try to hook up to the car a young couple are trying to hook-up in. Next, tempers and Pizza fly when Sonia, Matt, and Lyndah repo a pizza parlor's customer's car.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Daddy's Little Girl
programme.desc: The destruction of the repo team's truck has left the future of the company in the balance, but Matt's got a trick up his sleeve that might keep them afloat. Lou and Sonia head to a dark alley to take a van away from a pair of libidinous teens.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Adapt, Improvise, and Overcome
programme.desc: Lou takes his new guys on their very first repo but, when the debtors attack with chainsaws, Ronnie and Carlos are left to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Control Issue Episode
programme.desc: When Nick makes a point that Suzanne is too controlling of the family, Suzanne backs off the issue and later the family realizes that her controlling ways are just what they need.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Ghost Dog Episode
programme.desc: Nick, Suzanne, and Kevin pull pranks on each other, but their addiction leads to a near-death experience.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Lemon Squeeze Episode
programme.desc: Gigi uses an adequate exercise when the family refuses to stop fighting with each other.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Mother's-in-Law Episode

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.129
programme.desc: Prohibited confetti poppers at school cause serious injury; parents and teens dispute liability/Man sues granddaughter's boyfriend for cashing fraudulent check in relative's bank account.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.62
programme.desc: Man allegedly smashes ex-girlfriend's stereo in jealous rage; she accused of throwing his leather jacket in rain. Fight continues over parking fines. House sitter accused of trashing friend's apartment, damaging car while out of town.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.188
programme.desc: A troubled teen is at the center of a dispute between a woman and her son-in-law’s daughter over the cost of two airplane tickets to Pittsburgh. A woman sues her son-in-law’s granddaughter for money loaned to buy a mobile home.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.54
programme.desc: Man sues mother of his child for totaled 1999 Nissan Ultima value and pawn retrieval costs; she claims car ownership/Former best friends dispute unpaid rent, bills for shared townhouse amid single motherhood and break-up.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.105
programme.desc: Ex-friends dispute over money after unauthorized shower photos and drug possession arrest/Woman sues ex-friend for unpaid BMW balance; friend claims she donated car before paying off.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.63
programme.desc: Woman locks daughter out, sues for unpaid rent; daughter countersues for damages citing illegal eviction. Man denies owing ex-girlfriend for uninsured motorcycle he totaled, despite $17,000 pay-off amount left on co-signed vehicle.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.11
programme.desc: A daycare provider sues for slander after parents claim she was unlicensed, negligent, and had alcohol on the premises/Two boxers and a German Shepherd allegedly jump on a car and scratch the paint; ex-friends fight over damages.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.26
programme.desc: Intoxicated bride sues friend for face punch at wedding, accused teen claims self-defense/Woman accuses ex of cheating, he defends as moving on; dispute over living room set balance.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.6
programme.desc: Teen catfight leads to adult feud over truck vandalism/Teen crashes car after drunk 17-year-old allegedly permits him, sued by her father.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.140
programme.desc: Older couple accuses daughter and stepson-in-law of abuse including unpaid loans and theft; young couple denies. Man denies responsibility for drunk driving accident, claims friend knew he was intoxicated.

programme.title: America Decides

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Julia Roberts
programme.desc: Movie star Julia Roberts joins Bear on a lifesaving Red Nose Day adventure in Kenya. They're on a two-day trek enduring blistering savannah temperatures.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Keri Russell
programme.desc: Keri Russell and Bear journey through the Canary Islands; they dine on undigested seeds from a pigeon carcass, use a grappling hook and make a daring escape from a mountain peak using a paraglider; Keri discusses her family and path to fame.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Scott Eastwood

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Kate Hudson
programme.desc: Oscar-nominated actress Kate Hudson goes on a journey with Bear that involves a treacherous mountain range in Italy; Kate shares details of her unique upbringing.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Vanessa Hudgens
programme.desc: Bear and Vanessa Hudgens rappel from a helicopter into the high Sierra for a scenic adventure; Bear and Vanessa evade a boulder avalanche, summit a massive dormant volcano, and encounter a rattlesnake; Vanessa talks about her rise to stardom.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Deon Sanders
programme.desc: Bear Grylls takes NFL hall of famer Deion Sanders to the mesas and canyons of Utah for his first ever camping trip.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Global Cities
programme.desc: Travel to the centers of wealth, power, industry, and innovation. From London to Tokyo, Hong Kong to New York, these are the cities that never sleep. The influence held in these economic hubs unites the global community.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Island Nations
programme.desc: Though many are small in stature, they have punched well above their weight on the global stage. Some are rooted in ancient history, while others are only just beginning to realize their full potential.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Island Arks
programme.desc: Cut off from continents, remote islands have become floating arks, attracting migrating species and forging new ones. Take a privileged glimpse into the secret lives of the rare and exotic species that inhabit these lost worlds.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Water Adventures
programme.desc: We are captivated by oceans, rivers, and lakes - the power, the flow, the reflective stillness. And as we seek to get closer, we immerse ourselves in an expanding range of aquatic experiences.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Glaciers
programme.desc: Clinging to the world’s highest mountains and forming ice caps on both poles, glaciers leave an impression on the landscape and on all who bear witness to their splendor.

programme.title: Arthur: Fern and the Case of the Stolen Story/Sue Ellen Vegges Out
programme.desc: Fern has writer's block! Fortunately, Ladonna's full of stories, and Fern decides to "borrow" the tales and simply change the names. Then, when Sue Ellen decides to stop eating meat, Muffy and Francine compete to be the best vegetarian.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur and D.W. Clean Up/The Long, Dull Winter
programme.desc: Arthur just might make it to Happy Crazy Wow Day at the park--if he and D.W. can work together to clean their rooms! Then, Arthur and the gang realize they are suffering from the January doldrums brought on by an acute lack of holidays.

programme.title: Arthur: Attack Of The Turbo Tibbles/D.W. Tricks The Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: If you think the Tibbles are bad now, imagine what they'd be like if they had super powers! Then, D.W. needs money, quick. When she tries to pull a fast one on the Tooth Fairy, will Arthur have to pay?

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's New Puppy/Arthur Bounces Back
programme.desc: Arthur's new puppy is exactly what he wanted. He's cute and wriggly, and he follows Arthur everywhere. But training a puppy is harder than Arthur thought. Then, a mere $10 stands between Arthur and the shoes he's been dreaming about.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur and The Crunch Cereal Contest/D.W. Flips
programme.desc: A year's supply of Crunch Cereal is in store for the person who can write the new Crunch Cereal jingle, and Arthur is sure he can do it. Next, how hard can it be to do a cartwheel on a balance beam? D.W. is about to find out.

programme.title: Arthur: Adventures in Budylon/Ladonna Compson: Party Animal
programme.desc: D.W. and Bud embark on an epic wilderness adventure--the backyard has never been so exciting! Apple picking, bake sales, craft classes…there's so much to do in Elwood City in the fall! And Ladonna's determined to do it all.

programme.title: Arthur: Whip. Mix. Blend./Staycation
programme.desc: When Rattles's mom starts dating Archie Vanderloo, Rattles finds himself spending time with his twins, but they don’t have anything in common. Arthur offers to babysit so that his parents can enjoy some peace and quiet in the backyard.

programme.title: Arthur: The Cherry Tree/Matchmaker Matchbreaker
programme.desc: Muffy wants a Bouncy Castle at her party, but when her favorite cherry tree is cut down to make room for it, she starts to have regrets. Francine and Muffy scheme to set up their older siblings Chip and Catherine, but plans go awry.

programme.title: Arthur: D.W., All Fired Up/I'd Rather Read It Myself
programme.desc: When Ms. Morgan announces they'll be having a fire drill during preschool, D.W. wants no part of it--it sounds way too scary. Then, the Tibble Twins are better than D.W. at just about everything.

programme.title: Blitz the Aftermath
programme.desc: With interviews and archive footage showing the sheer amount of devastation – from the loss of life to the immense damage caused to buildings across the country - The Aftermath looks at how the Blitz changed the face of Britain's cities and lives.

programme.title: Brothers In Arms
programme.desc: The young men who joined up together, fought together and died together in World War One.

programme.title: D-Day: Secret Raids That Won The War
programme.desc: Examining the RAF 617 squadron and their history of operations throughout the war.

programme.title: The Blitz
programme.desc: The Blitz looks at the build-up to the raids and detailed footage of the destruction that followed. It features interviews from those who lived through it and stories of sadness and bravery, at a time when Britain held strong and swore not to surrender.

programme.title: War Story: Bomber Command: Hitting Back
programme.desc: After surviving the German bombing campaign of British cities, RAF Bomber Command struck back against Germany. The devastating consequences of raids, for both for the young men in the skies and the people on the ground, are portrayed in this film.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Chitara & Priscilla
programme.desc: Chitara took a big leap and came out to her family when she met Priscilla online, but Priscilla ended their relationship unexpectedly. Now Chitara is determined to find out what happened. (S4, ep5)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Mike & Felicia
programme.desc: Mike and Felicia met online and soon hit it off. After agreeing to meet, Felicia stood Mike up, offering only thin excuses. Can Mike trust Felicia - or will he end up disappointed?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Southern sweetheart Kelsie is madly in love with her online Romeo, Brandon. But after years of endless excuses about meeting up, Kelsie recruits Nev and Max to find who Brandon really is. (S6, ep14)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Mama doesn't always know best. Shuntay enlists the help of Nev and Max after her mum begins talking about marriage and uprooting her family to be with a man who refuses to meet in person. (S5, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: After three long years, Robin is desperate to finally meet her elusive, hunky, long-distance love in person. Nev and Max agree to help her hunt him down, but what they uncover turns out to be much more than Robin bargained for!

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Miracle & Javonni
programme.desc: Smart, single mum Miracle fell for Javonni, a dreamy-eyed Instagrammer. With Max on hiatus, Nev teams up with TV personality Charlamagne to take Miracle on a hunt for the man of her dreams.

programme.title: The City: Working Girls
programme.desc: Whitney wonders if working with a friend is a good idea when Roxy steps out of line on day one. Olivia wins Joe Zee's approval on a new project at ELLE, but Erin isn't impressed. (S1, ep15)

programme.title: The City: Its All Who You Know
programme.desc: Whitney goes behind Kelly's back to show her fashion designs to Bergdorf Goodman. Olivia shocks Erin by using her fashion world connections to succeed at her biggest ELLE task. (S1, ep16)

programme.title: The City: Meet the Fackelmayers
programme.desc: Whitney meets some cute brothers. Olivia thrives at an ELLE Magazine cocktail party &amp; Erin reminds her that the fashion business isn't just about who you know but what you know. (S1, ep17)

programme.title: The City: Hit It And Quit It
programme.desc: Whitney grows cautious about Freddie just as her ex, Jay, comes back into the picture. Roxy clashes with Olivia when People's Revolution and Elle join forces to put on a party. (S1, ep18)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Reunion
programme.desc: The Guidos and Guidettes get together for one last time in a special reunion show to relive the highs and lows from six seasons of outrageous and hilarious antics.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: From the First Fist Pump
programme.desc: An entertaining look back at the first three seasons of Jersey Shore - complete with all the comedy, drama, mischievous antics, and water cooler moments that keep people talking.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Going to Italia
programme.desc: The housemates pack up their hair extensions & Shore Store t-shirts & jet off for an Italian adventure. But the culture-shock that awaits is nothing compared to their shocking new hook-ups. (S4, ep1)

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Imposter
programme.desc: A report about an elusive con man David Pecard, who has taken on more than 20 identities throughout his life of crime. Pecard has infiltrated police departments and top military posts, put criminals behind bars and even posed as a technician.

programme.title: 48 Hours: My Father's Killer
programme.desc: James Bernard Campbell entered SueZann Bosler's home, murdered her father and almost killed her. 48 HOURS follows SueZann as she returns to the crime scene and then focuses on her unusual crusade for justice.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Death Wish
programme.desc: A report surrounding the July 2009 death of Jeffrey Locker, whose body was found slumped over the steering wheel of his car in Harlem, New York. When authorities tracked Locker’s ATM card to Kenneth Minor, Minor said Locker had begged Minor to kill him.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Deadly Secret
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the Kalamazoo, Michigan's cold case unit's investigation of the September 1994 disappearance of Khristine Smith, a seemingly happy wife and mother.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Exposed
programme.desc: A report about serial killer Bill Bradford, who posed as an amateur photographer and told women he’d make them famous. Convicted of two murders, Bradford has been on death row since 1988.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Perfect Family
programme.desc: A young man is on trial for the murder of his mother.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield tells Odie about the stage team of Jackie and his cat Buddy.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield’s and Odie’s minds are switched. Orson tries to read Cinderella.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Nighty-Nightmare/U.S Acres: Banana Nose/Ode to Odie
programme.desc: Garfield has a nightmare where he grows into a gigantic cat, climbing tall buildings./Roy has his feelings hurt when he is called "Banana Nose."/Odie meets with a tough alley dog and two lady dogs.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Hound of the Arbuckles/Read Alert/Urban Arbuckle
programme.desc: Garfield imagines he's a cunning Dr. Watson./As Orson looks through his books./Cactus Jake suggest that Jon try dating Cactus Jackie.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield is bitten by the video game bug. Orson dreams he’s double-Oh Orson again.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: D.J Jon/Cornfinger/Five Minute Warning
programme.desc: Jon becomes a D.J./The super fpy, Double-O-Orson returns./Jon bets Garfield that he can't go five minutes without eating.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Dr. Bean tries again to use Odie as the basis for robot dogs. Orson dreams he’s Power Pig.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Wonderful World/Orson Awards/Garfield Workout
programme.desc: Jon, Garfield and Odie head to the Wonder World amusement park./Roy and Orson's brothers scheme to get the big award./Garfield shows some of his favorite exercises.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Ship Shape/Barn of Fear 2/Break a Leg
programme.desc: Jon goes on a cruise./The ancestors of the U.S. Acres assist in foil-ing Orson's greedy brothers./Garfield and Odie tag along as Jon heads to a ski lodge.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Sludge Monster/Fortune Kooky/Heatwave Holiday
programme.desc: Jon, Garfield and Odie spend the night in a spooky hotel./Orson tries to convince Wade that fortune cookies aren't accurate./On a hot summer day, Garfield brings out the Christmas decorations.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Takeover
programme.desc: A political boss hires a professional provocateur to stage a violent protest, in a maneuver to discredit his state's governor and elevate his puppet, the mayor, to the governorship in "Takeover"

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Missile
programme.desc: The IMF devises an elaborate scheme to dupe foreign agent James Reed into stealing a bogus missile guidance system in "The Missile"

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Blast
programme.desc: Henry Darrow guest stars as Gregory Tolan, the local leader of a revolutionist group specializing in robberies for the financing of a movement to overthrow the United States government in the "Blast"

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: A Ghost Story
programme.desc: Andrew Duggan guest stars as Justin Bainbridge, a multimillionaire paranoid militarist, whose son, Howard, defected behind the Iron Curtain with the formula to a lethal nerve gas he had developed in "A Ghost Story"

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Party
programme.desc: The whereabouts of a list of enemy agents operating in the United States are locked in the memory of a captured spy, Col. Vanin (guest star Frank Marth), and no one, including the spy, can penetrate his mind in "The Party"

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Igarashi observes the interactions between Bunpei and Yoko. Golfing daily with Tonbo, he wants her to try tournament golf. However, he feels there's something unusual about her play. Unexpectedly, a squall hits them on the course.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Igarashi's unease with Tonbo's golf stems from Tonbo not feeling the pressure of competitions, but Tonbo's actions make him reconsider. Learning from Yoko that Tonbo hates leaving the island, Igarashi realizes that a change in perspective is needed.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Igarashi heads to Kagoshima to find one who can match Tonbo but failed. He learns that Yoko’s niece is a junior tournament winner. So he arranges her visit to Hino Island. Days later, a pickup truck arrives by ferry, with the girl sleeping in the back.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Despite meeting for the first time, Tonbo and Tsubura decided to play a round on the island's golf course. Inspired by each other's contrasting styles, a competitive spirit grows within Tonbo, determined not to lose.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: During a typhoon on Hinojima, Tonbo and Tsubura took refuge. Despite the power outage, Tsubura practiced her swings and shared her feelings. After the storm, she gave Tonbo her 5-wood. Igarashi found a hidden golf hole and took Tonbo to play it.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Igarashi goes to Akureki to meet Mr. Kuta, designer of the Hinonoshima golf course. He shares his past with Tonbo, who fears leaving the island. The next morning, Tonbo joins him. Mr. Kuta shows them a special one-hole course in the forest near a pond.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Mr. Kuta's single-hole course on Akureki Island was a challenging monster hole. Igarashi struggles with it, while Tonbo impresses with creative shots. However, Mr. Kuta has doubts about Tonbo using a 3-iron for putting.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Mr. Kuta insists Tonbo's golf style won't work in competition and takes them to a challenging practice green. Tonbo spends the day tackling it, growing to appreciate Igarashi and Mr. Kuta's kindness.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: After Akurekijima, Tonbo penned "The Last Summer Vacation" essay, expressing love for the island and resolutions. Islanders were surprised; Igaiga supported her. By spring graduation, Tonbo grew taller, hair reaching her shoulders.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Tonbo's decision to leave the island deeply affected the nearby residents. Amidst mixed emotions, a farewell golf tournament was held with just one day left until her departure.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: The Pimple
programme.desc: When a pimple pops up just before Tia's big date, Tamera agrees to step in for her -- and finds herself falling for Tia's guy.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Car Trouble
programme.desc: Tamera scratches the fender of her father's prized car, then tries to hide the truth with the help of Tia and Roger.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: The Birthday
programme.desc: The twins' first birthday together leaves Tamera's best friend feeling left out, and Ray locked in an argument with Lisa over his parenting methods.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Love Strikes

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Mothers & Other Strangers
programme.desc: When Lisa's disapproving mother comes for a visit, Ray agrees to pose as her husband.

programme.title: Flashpoint

programme.title: Flashpoint

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Its early morning and there’s a strange creature in Sunflower Valley. First of all it visits the Homestead and then Scarecrow Cottage scaring Sumsy and Travis. It’s something big and hairy, but gets frightened away by Scrambler carrying Baz.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are finishing refurbishing the old watermill ready to begin milling the first Sunflower Valley flour. Work is just about to start when Dizzy hears a squeaking noise coming from above. There are bats in the old mill!

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob has been making secret early morning trips to the school where Mrs Percival has been giving him salsa lessons, as he wants to impress everybody at the town dance that night.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Farmer Pickles wants a fence built around his compost heap, as Scruffty keeps getting into it. Muck is excited at the prospect of such a mucky job. JJ sends Trix up to the farm with the materials.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roley is desperate to help with the apple harvest, but there’s not much a road roller can do to help. Farmer Pickles, meanwhile, asks Bob to build him a new press to make apple juice. Roley tries to help Spud collect a load of apples

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The Mayor asks Bob to build a Pets Corner in the local park. Farmer Pickles has picked up a selection of animals for it – including a chinchilla – and sends Travis and Spud off to deliver them to Bob. Unfortunately Bob runs out of chicken wire.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Farmer Pickles is about to declare his Sunflower Oil business open, but there’s just one more job that he needs Bob to do. He needs a depot to store all the bottles of oil.

programme.title: Homes and Playgrounds
programme.desc: Join Bob and his “Can-Do” crew as they go back on site to show you the exciting real world of big machines! From bird’s nests to houses, we all need a home and in this brand new adventure Bob explains how they are built.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the gang are replacing some old pipes outside the town hall. Molly, meanwhile, is practicing for her first aid exam with a reluctant JJ as guinea pig. When Wendy calls JJ’s yard to order a special pipe and Molly offers to deliver it.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is tiling a roof and calls at JJ’s yard to pick up the materials. But there is only one pallet of the requisite red tiles in stock, so JJ promises to send the remainder of the order as soon as his delivery arrives.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Train enthusiast Mr Bentley is away for the day and, in his absence, Mrs Bentley decides to surprise her husband by asking Bob to build him a brand new model railway in the shed.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Today’s the day that the machines get to build their brand new shelter. It’s going to be built into the side of a hill and made using found materials. Lofty, who slept outside at the old yard, decides that he’d like a place in the new shelter.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Beasley’s pipes and boiler are making banging noises and Bob is called in to replace them. Whilst Bob and Wendy are collecting the new Boiler from JJ, Molly explains that she is looking after Mrs Broadbent’s baby rabbits.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Keith Blakelock
programme.desc: In 1985, PC Keith Blakelock was murdered during a riot on a housing estate in London, triggered after a black woman died of heart failure during a house search. Nobody has been brought to justice for his murder, despite three investigations.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Christopher Foster
programme.desc: Failed businessman Christopher Foster killed his wife and daughter before burning their mansion in Shropshire to the ground in August 2008.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Gemma McCluskie
programme.desc: The harrowing story of EastEnders actress Gemma McCluskie, who was murdered by her older brother in the flat they shared in east London in 2012.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Lee Rigby
programme.desc: In broad daylight on a busy Woolwich street on 22nd May 2013, serving soldier Fusilier Lee Rigby was attacked and murdered by Islamic extremists Michael Adebolajo and Michael Adebowale.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: April Jones

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Jimmy Savile
